objection_handlers.objection: Temp workers cost more per hour than permanent employees
objection_handlers.underlying_fear: Wasting money, being taken advantage of
objection_handlers.authentic_response: You're right about the hourly rate, and here's why it's still often cheaper: You're not paying benefits (30% on top of salary), not paying for downtime between projects, not paying unemployment when you don't need them, and not paying for bad hires. Let's calculate your actual cost per productive hour - most clients find temps cost 15-20% less when you factor in the full picture.
objection_handlers.proof_point: Track your all-in cost for your last permanent hire including benefits, training time, and recruitment. Compare to [X] weeks of temp coverage.

objection_handlers.objection: I need someone who knows my business, not a stranger
objection_handlers.underlying_fear: Training time, mistakes, disruption to operations
objection_handlers.authentic_response: That's exactly why we specialize in [INDUSTRY/ROLE TYPE]. Our temps have worked at businesses like yours - they know the software, the workflow, the pace. Yes, there's a learning curve for your specific setup, but it's hours not weeks. And here's the thing: your permanent employees were strangers once too. The difference is you can try our temps without a multi-year commitment.
objection_handlers.proof_point: Our average temp is productive within [X] days because of their prior experience in [INDUSTRY]. We can send someone who's already done this exact role.

objection_handlers.objection: What if they don't show up or quit suddenly?
objection_handlers.underlying_fear: Being left in the lurch, back to square one
objection_handlers.authentic_response: This is our reputation on the line, not just yours. If a temp no-shows or quits, we replace them same-day - that's in writing. We also screen for reliability: work history, references, attendance records. Our show-up rate is [X]% because we only send people who've proven themselves. And unlike a permanent hire who can quit anytime, we maintain backup candidates for your role.
objection_handlers.proof_point: In the last [X] months, we've had [Y]% same-day replacement rate when needed. Compare that to waiting weeks to replace a permanent employee who quits.

objection_handlers.objection: I don't have time to train someone new right now
objection_handlers.underlying_fear: Adding work instead of reducing it
objection_handlers.authentic_response: I hear you - you're already underwater. But here's the reality: training a temp for 2 hours today gives you 38 productive hours this week. Not training them means you work those 40 hours yourself or burn out your team further. We can also send someone who's worked with [SOFTWARE/PROCESS/INDUSTRY] before to minimize ramp-up. The question isn't whether you have time to train - it's whether you can afford not to get help.
objection_handlers.proof_point: Most clients spend [X] hours on initial training and get [Y] weeks of productive work. That's a [Z]x return on your training investment.

objection_handlers.objection: I've had bad experiences with temp agencies before
objection_handlers.underlying_fear: Repeating past disappointment, wasting time and money
objection_handlers.authentic_response: What specifically went wrong? [Listen] That's frustrating, and honestly, not all agencies operate the same way. Here's how we're different: [SPECIFIC DIFFERENCE BASED ON THEIR COMPLAINT]. But don't take my word for it - let's do a trial placement. If they don't meet the standard we discussed, you don't pay for that day and we send someone else. You're in control.
objection_handlers.proof_point: We've won over [X] clients who switched from other agencies. Here's what [REFERENCE] said about the difference: [SPECIFIC QUOTE].

objection_handlers.objection: I'm worried about quality - temps won't care like permanent staff
objection_handlers.underlying_fear: Damage to customer relationships, subpar work
objection_handlers.authentic_response: Some temps are just passing through - you're right. But many of our best temps are professionals who prefer flexibility: parents, semi-retired experts, people building careers. They know their next assignment depends on their performance with you. We also check in regularly and remove anyone who doesn't meet your standards immediately. Plus, here's something most people don't think about: temps often work harder because they're being evaluated constantly, while some permanent employees coast once they're comfortable.
objection_handlers.proof_point: Our client satisfaction rating for temp quality is [X]%. We can also show you the background and experience of candidates before they start.

objection_handlers.objection: I need to think about it / talk to my partner
objection_handlers.authentic_response: Absolutely, this should be a thoughtful decision. To help your conversation, what specific concerns do you need to work through? [Address those] Also, thinking about it is fine when you have time - but what's your plan for [SPECIFIC COVERAGE NEED] while you decide? If you wait a week and then call us, that's another week of [CURRENT PAIN]. What if we set up coverage starting [DATE] while you evaluate? You can always adjust or cancel with [X] notice.
objection_handlers.proof_point: Most clients who wait wish they'd started sooner. The average client recoups their investment in [X] days through [SPECIFIC BENEFIT].

objection_handlers.underlying_fear: Overpaying for something they can do themselves
objection_handlers.authentic_response: You absolutely can, and you'll save our fee. You'll also spend [X] hours screening resumes, [Y] hours interviewing, handle payroll tax setup, carry the liability insurance, and hope they show up Monday. If they don't work out, you start over.
